revised_title: Exploring the Structure of Molten and Glassy 2:1 Binary Systems
tldr: The author analyzes the structure of molten and glassy 2:1 binary systems using the Bhatia-Thornton formalism. They focus on the first sharp diffraction peak, which is a signature of directional bonding and intermediate-range order. The study reveals differences in the structures of molten and glassy systems, with the former having a more pronounced first sharp diffraction peak, indicating a higher degree of covalent character and directional bonding.
